pageTextData.subTitle: Start
pageTextData.description: I chose my favourite car Camaro (the model of bumblebee transformer) to model. Firstly, I found the blueprint of it. Then cut it into pieces and set them into the 3ds Max 2017. Click on the image to get a larger version

pageTextData.subTitle: Parts
pageTextData.description: This image illustrates the parts I built, such as the car body, windows, wheels and the lights, since I haven’t use MAX before, I followed a tutorial from the YouTube so that I won’t miss anything. Click on the image to get a larger version.

pageTextData.subTitle: Material
pageTextData.description: After modelling the tire, the whole car looks complete, then I add standard materials to each part, I also added lights and background to make it looks clearly.

pageTextData.subTitle: Render
pageTextData.description: I rendered with Scanline Render. As for me, I’m quite satisfied with the render result. Click on the image to get a larger version.

pageTextData.subTitle: Animation
pageTextData.description: This movie shows an animation of the Camaro in 3ds Max 2017.

pageTextData.subTitle: X3D Model
pageTextData.description: Here we can now see the online X3D model (X3D in the HTML DOM, i.e. X3DOM) of the Camaro. Use your mouse to navigate around the model in 3D

pageTextData.subTitle: Start
pageTextData.description: As for photorealistic part, to be honest, I also follow the tutorial. Firstly, I set the light, the ground plane and the background, then I test material and bit map with a teapot. Seeing the location and view suitable, I merged the car.

pageTextData.subTitle: Material
pageTextData.description: This image illustrates the steps I editing the car with the Arch and Design Materials, such wheels, windows and the head parts.

pageTextData.subTitle: Color
pageTextData.description: I add effects of reflection and test the colour I like.

pageTextData.subTitle: Final Photorealistic Image
pageTextData.description: Then, I made the ground plane visible so that the shadow could be observable.  I also adjust a little bit to make the car reach the ground. Finally, I rendered with the NVIDIA mental ray.

pageTextData.subTitle: Modelling
pageTextData.description: At first, I follow the tutorials and everything looks good, I used different common types of control, such as vertex, edge and polygon to build the surfaces. I also learnt many shortcut keys to achieve change view and insert parts.

pageTextData.subTitle: Cameras and Lights
pageTextData.description: I set the camera at a comfortable and clear view to see the whole car. In order to make the car seems clearly and shinning, I added standard light of Direct from the top front of the car. I also added Omni near the back of the car, so that it looks clearly.

pageTextData.subTitle: Animation
pageTextData.description: Thanks to having the module of 3D Animation and help of the tutorial, I finished the animation fluently. Since the frame too few, I set 3 cameras and play the animation three time in different views. To make it looks realistic, I edited the wheel rotating speed and added rotation of the car body.

pageTextData.subTitle: Exporting to VRML97 and Rendering in X3D
pageTextData.description: However, things became tough, I exported the model but cannot read by IE, so I stopped and looked for help. Luckily, I narrowed down the problem according to the suggestion from the tutor. Then I fix them from Editable Mesh to Poly, I thought the reason is that I didn’t check the status carefully after collapsing. Fortunately, I didn’t need to rebuild a new one. Then I transcode successfully and rendered into .x3d file. To my surprise, even though I replaced the files I still see the original objects on the website. With the help of classmate, I reloaded and be able to see my works.

pageTextData.subTitle: Photorealistic Rendering
pageTextData.description: Following the tutorial, I achieve material editing. I have run into several troubles, for instance when I added the material towards wheels the result incorrect, so I copied the correct one for 3 times. To be honest, because of lacking the experience, I feel the image is not so realistic. Partly because the colour and material, another reason I thought might be the sight view, which need more practice. After all, I have to say that I have learnt lots of function and tips of 3ds MAX. It is amazing to finish a realistic model.
